page.title: 16FARMING-GENERAL
page.content: This area of East Cornwall has some of the richest agricultural land in the county.The farms average 250 acres, and with one exception,are dairy farms.75% are under tennancy,the others are family owned and run.One farm has a herd of 40 pedigree south devon cattle exsporting world wide and also grazes 100 pedigree long wool sheep.All other farms milk an average of 75 friesian cows.Bullocks and suffork or dorset cross sheep are kept.There is one pig unit at south hill.Arable land is down to grass for silage,hay,barley,roots and Brassicas for animal feed.Three frams grow potatoes commercially.A lot of modernisation has taken place.New lambing sheds and milking parlours and large storage tanks.Capital outlay is reflected in over-drafts and rents which has risen from Â£10-Â£43 per acre.
